data.title: EUROCONTROL | Supporting European Aviation
data.meta_description: Our activities touch on operations, service provision, concept development, research, Europe-wide project implementation, performance improvements, coordination with key aviation players at various levels as well as providing support to the future evolution and strategic orientations of aviation.
data.text:
Homepage

EUROCONTROL is a pan-European, civil-military organisation dedicated to supporting European aviation.

Notice

Due to scheduled maintenance, the EUROCONTROL website may be temporarily unavailable between 17:00 and 20:00 CEST today. This does not impact the operational websites.

Live traffic

Real-time European air traffic situation map.

NOP (Network Operations Portal)

Your gateway to interact with EUROCONTROL's Network Manager Operations Centre.

AIU Portal

Our online air navigation services performance data portal.

Key products

EUROCONTROL European Aviation Overview

Read the latest status of the European air traffic network.

EUROCONTROL Data Snapshots

Our 46th EUROCONTROL Data Snapshot deals with the average flight in the EUROCONTROL area.

EUROCONTROL Aviation Trends

Our latest EUROCONTROL European Aviation Trends briefing looks ahead to the Paris Olympics and Paralympics, taking place from late July to early September.

Skyway magazine

EUROCONTROL's official magazine, Skyway has developed into an authoritative voice, examining in depth the major challenges to improving European aviation performance.

Aviation Sustainability Briefing

Our latest issue explores how EUROCONTROL will support aviation in its decarbonisation efforts with our #FlyingGreen roadmap.

EUROCONTROL Think Papers & Analyses

Our latest Think Paper assesses whether cutting-edge energies & technologies can make a difference in decarbonising long-haul flights.

EUROCONTROL Seven-Year Forecast

Air traffic in Europe is not expected to recover to 2019 levels until 2025.

EUROCONTROL Aviation Outlook 2050

This long-term air traffic forecast charts how aviation can achieve net-zero CO2 emissions by 2050.

Subscribe

Keep abreast of what is happening in the aviation world.
